headshotImage.caption: Peter Ongondo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Peter Ongondo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sourav Ganguly c sub (PJ Ongondo) b Chigumbura 88 (112b 9x4 1x6 179m) SR: 78.57

dismissalComment.html: and he perishes, standing in his crease and swinging a full toss below the waist across the line and it spirals up in the air for Ongondo to hold onto a good catch running in from deep square leg, so there's no hundred for Ganguly, but he hung around and dug in for a fighting 88

headshotImage.caption: M Morkel headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: M Morkel headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Virender Sehwag c M Morkel b Chigumbura 52 (38b 8x4 1x6 60m) SR: 136.84

dismissalComment.html: and what's he done next ball? He loosely, and I'm talking somewhat one-handedly, gets over-confident and lofts a well-disguised slower ball straight into the hands of long-on, who doesnt have to move much from his position well inside the ropes

headshotImage.caption: M Morkel headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: M Morkel headshot

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Yousuf player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Yousuf player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: edged and gone! Yousuf sees the half-volley, gets onto bended knee and square-drives the legcutter but the result is a simple outside edge into Boucher's gloves

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rafique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rafique player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and he goes, standing and slashing one up into the air, and thats an excellent catch from de Villiers, who covers a huge amount of distance running back from cover, keeping his eyes on the ball as it dies against the starry night, and pouching it in front of him! Morne applauds his fielder, and rightfully so

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene run out (de Villiers/Sibanda) 45 (40b 4x4 1x6 51m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: oh Ganguly, Ganguly, Ganguly, who's been involved in 51 run outs, taps one to the off side, shuffles a few steps, sees Jayawardene harry down the pitch and then sends him back to his fate, and he's not even in the frame as a good throw comes in and Sibanda whips off the bails...poor call for a run

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Boucher c Mohammad Asif b Fernando 73 (71b 4x4 2x6 96m) SR: 102.81

dismissalComment.html: all over for him! Fernando doesnt waste time in this spell, following up the lovely yorker with a length delivery on middle and leg, which Boucher gets under and hits high in the air and down Asif's throat at long-on

dismissalText.commentary: Boeta Dippenaar c sub (Harbhajan Singh) b Yuvraj Singh 67 (72b 9x4 0x6 114m) SR: 93.05

dismissalComment.html: gone! He gets into position to pull a fractionally short ball on leg stump, hitting with the wind and with little power and Harbhajan, running around from deep midwicket, judges it to perfection

headshotImage.longCaption: Vusi Sibanda page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the set-up works, as Sibanda gets tangled up pulling one thats not quite there for that shot, he's very late on the shot and the ball takes the top-edge and balloons up high behind the stumps for Dhoni to keep an eye on it and pouch a simple take

image.caption: Justin Kemp profile
image.credit: United Cricket Board of South Africa

headshotImage.caption: Justin Kemp player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Justin Kemp player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: tiiiiiiiiiimber! Kemp's woeful run at the international level continues, as like against Asif at Bangalore he junges forward and drives lustily, only to completely misread the line and his off stump is pegged back

headshotImage.caption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: all over for him! Fernando doesnt waste time in this spell, following up the lovely yorker with a length delivery on middle and leg, which Boucher gets under and hits high in the air and down Asif's throat at long-on

headshotImage.caption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Johan Botha player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and he cleans up Botha first ball as he heaves across the line and loses his off stump

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rafique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rafique player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: E Chigumbura headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: E Chigumbura headshot

dismissalComment.html: what a catch! Chigumbura gets down on one knee and slams this high and down to long-on, the ball is in the air for some time and comes down to where Harbhajan lines it up perfectly on the ropes, jumps and takes it inches inside the boundary, immense effort and doesnt Harbhajan love it?

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: good catch from Ganguly! Morkel comes out, Rafique fires it in flat on leg stump, and the aerial flick off the pads is held inches off the ground by a diving Ganguly at mid-on

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c †Dhoni b Mohammad Asif 13 (10b 1x4 0x6 12m) SR: 130

dismissalComment.html: edged and what a superb take from Dhoni, diving full length to his right and holding it an inch off the ground to send de Villiers back to the hut, and again Asif has his man, pitching one on middle stump and deviating it off the seam to flummox the batsman, classical pace bowler's dismissal

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel b Mohammad Asif 25 (21b 4x4 0x6 26m) SR: 119.04

commentTextItems.html: sends his off stump for a walk as Morne eyes up midwicket and swings across the line, and the Asians have won this game by 31 runs and have the series in the bag

commentPostTextItems.html: A solid batting effort swept Asia to 337 and bar two good fifties from Boeta Dippenaar and Mark Boucher the Africans couldnt get matters away. Dilhara Fernando picked up a career-best 4 for 36 to lead the bowling honours. So Asia have won the 2007 edition but do feel free to join us for our live coverage of the final game at this same venue tomorrow, Sunday, June 10. Sriram Veera will bring you the commentary.
Hope you've enjoyed today's match. This is Jamie Alter signing off. Cheers!

commentTextItems.html: full toss on leg stump which he clips to midwicket
dragged in short outside off stump and Morkel moves to 25 with a firm pull over midwicket, couple of bounces and over the ropes
full on leg stump, driven to Yousuf at mid-off
back of a length on off stump and he pushes it back down the track
bounces one down leg stump and wide is the call as Odoyo leaves it be
and he ends his spell with a bouncer over leg stump which Morkel cant put away with his attempted pull shot

commentPostTextItems.html: Good bowling effort from the big man Fernando

commentTextItems.html: marginally overpitched outside off stump and he uses the feet to drive this on the up for four to long-off

overpitched outside off stump and Odoyo drives nicely through the covers for one
back of a length outside off stump, Morne drives down to Sehwag at long-on
slower one, moving away from outside off stump and Morne gives it everything only to miss it all
short of a length on leg stump and he hammers it away through midwicket for one

milestones.description: Thomas Odoyo has broken the record for most sixes (2) in ODIs for AFR, going past Chigumbura's 1
Mohammad Yousuf has broken the record for most sixes in an innings (2) in ODIs for ASIA, going past Sehwag's 1
Mark Boucher has broken the record for most sixes in an innings (2) in ODIs for AFR, going past de Villiers's 1
Ganguly's 88 is the highest individual score in ODIs (for ASIA), surpassing Rahul Dravid's 75
Morne Morkel has become the top wicket-taker for AFR in ODIs with 5 wickets, going past Shaun Pollock's 4
Chigumbura has conceded the most runs in an innings (84) in ODIs for AFR, going past Morne Morkel's record of 68
Mohammad Asif has conceded the most runs in an innings (82) in ODIs for ASIA, going past Anil Kumble's record of 73
de Villiers has broken the record for most catches (4) in ODIs for AFR, going past Shaun Pollock's 3
Ganguly and MS Dhoni's 57-run partnership is ASIA's highest for the 3rd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 31 between Ganguly and Rahul Dravid
Ganguly and Mohammad Yousuf's 84-run partnership is ASIA's highest for the 5th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 54 between Mohammad Yousuf and Yuvraj Singh
Mohammad Yousuf and Yuvraj Singh's 33-run partnership is ASIA's highest for the 6th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 17 between Rahul Dravid and Abdul Razzaq
Dippenaar and Vusi Sibanda's 60-run partnership is AFR's highest for the 2nd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 27 between Dippenaar and de Villiers
Mark Boucher and Dippenaar's 79-run partnership is AFR's highest for the 4th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 9 between Kallis and Prince
Shaun Pollock and Mark Boucher's 58-run partnership is AFR's highest for the 5th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 46 between Justin Kemp and de Villiers
Thomas Odoyo and Morne Morkel's 43-run partnership is AFR's highest for the 10th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 26 between Shaun Pollock and Morne Morkel
This is the highest match aggregate (643) involving teams Asia XI & Africa XI in ODIs
Zaheer Khan has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (6) for ASIA, going past Mohammad Yousuf
Dippenaar has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (5) for AFR, going past Justin Kemp

stories.title: Fernando secures series win for Asia

stories.seoTitle: Fernando secures series win for Asia
stories.summary: Like in the first ODI at Bangalore, Asia won the toss, elected to bat on a flat pitch and batted the opposition out of the game, only this time the victory was more comprehensive
stories.byline: The Bulletin by Kanishkaa Balachandran at Chennai

stories.title: Africans rev themselves up to salvage series
stories.subTitle: Asia XI v Africa XI, 2nd ODI, Chennai
stories.seoTitle: Africans rev themselves up to salvage series
stories.summary: In a day when both teams decided to take it easy in practice, the focus was on the endurance levels of the players and both captains chose not to dwell on team changes and strategies
stories.byline: The Preview by Kanishkaa Balachandran at Chennai
